title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Without beingaware of it, Hogg had crossed the gully of the Douglas Burn on a bridgeformed by the deep snow, and crossed over the park wall in similarfashion.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: He should long ago have reached the Douglas Burn, but nota sign even suggestive of such a thing as a watercourse had he yet seen.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: But what put some dread in his mind was the knowledge that between himand home lay the Douglas Burn, possibly by now in spate, and dangerousto cross.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John

title: Noctes ambrosianae,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: I left Altrive after breakfast- about nine and the Douglas Burn lookin gey temptin, I tried it wi the black gnat, and sune creeled some fowre or five dizzen the maist o them sina few exceedin a pund.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: Whennot engaged against a foreign foe, or in settlinga neighbouring feud, they were wont to sally forthfrom their tower on Douglas Burn, pursuing the wilddeer, with which their glen and glades abounded.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: He was born in 1780at Blackhouse, on the Douglas Burn, under theshadow of its ruined tower.
